trigger detail ; To run this trigger, it must be declared ‘public web’. Otherwise, it results in a security error on webget. public web
; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the entity. ; Code executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_CLEAR.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity>
clear/e "<$entname>"
end
Button to clear retrieved data from component

trigger detail ; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the entity. ; Code executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated in each occurrence: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_CLEAR.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity>
clear/e "<$entname>"
end

trigger detail ; To run this trigger, it must be declared ‘public web’. Otherwise, it results in a security error on webget. public web
; Creates a new occurrence after current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_CREOCC.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; ... ; </x-occurrence>
creocc "<$entname>", $curocc("<$entname>") ; Insert code to generate any technical keys, e.g. ; KEYFIELD.<$entname> = $uuid
end

trigger detail ; Creates a new occurrence after current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_CREOCC.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; ... ; </x-occurrence>
creocc "<$entname>", $curocc("<$entname>") ; Insert code to generate any technical keys, e.g. ; KEYFIELD.<$entname> = $uuid
end

trigger detail ; To run this trigger, it must be declared ‘public web’. Otherwise, it results in a security error on webget. public web
; Retrieves data from database and loads them as occurrences into the entity. ; Code is executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_RETRIEVE.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity> ; 3. This trigger reports in the mesasage frame, make sure to visualize it in your layout, using the following html: ; <x-subst type="function" name="$putmess"> ; putmess area - display the contents of the message frame ; </x-subst>
variables string vProfiles endvariables
#ifdefined option_1 ; Optionally copy single ooccurrence from a dedicated profile entity to be used as profile clear/e "<$entname>" putlistitems/occ vProfiles, "PROFILE_ENTITY" getlistitems/occ/init vProfiles, "<$entname>" #endif
retrieve/e "<$entname>" selectcase $procerror case 0 ; ok case -2, -4 putmess "Retrieve: No data found in the database." elsecase putmess "Retrieve: Error occurred - (%%($procerror))." endselectcase
return 0
end
Button to retrieve data from the database

trigger detail ; Retrieves data from the database and loads it as occurrences into the entity. ; Code is executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_RETRIEVE.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity> ; 3. This trigger reports in the mesasage frame, make sure to visualize it in your layout, using the following html: ; <x-subst type="function" name="$putmess"> ; putmess area - display the contents of the message frame ; </x-subst>
variables string vProfiles endvariables
#ifdefined option_1 ; Optionally copy single ooccurrence from a dedicated profile entity to be used as profile clear/e "<$entname>" putlistitems/occ vProfiles, "PROFILE_ENTITY" getlistitems/occ/init vProfiles, "<$entname>" #endif
retrieve/e "<$entname>" selectcase $procerror case 0 ; ok case -2, -4 putmess "Retrieve: No data found in the database." elsecase putmess "Retrieve: Error occurred - (%%($procerror))." endselectcase
return 0
end

trigger detail ; To run this trigger, it must be declared ‘public web’. Otherwise, it results in a security error on webget. public web
; Stores occurrences that are modified into the database and deletes any occurrences marked for deletion from the database. ; Code is executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Optionally, define a component variable of type struct and report any validation errors to it in the entity and field 'error' triggers. ; Define a constant DATAERRORS with the name of this component variable. ; 3. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_STORE.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity> ; 4. This trigger reports in the mesasage frame, make sure to visualize it in your layout, using the following html: ; <x-subst type="function" name="$putmess"> ; putmess area - display the contents of the message frame ; </x-subst>
#ifdefined option_1 ; Delete the selected occurrences (or perform some other action on the selected occurrences) ; TO DO: ; 1. Add an additional boolean field (e.g. check-box) to the structure of the entity to be controlled, ; this field is used to hold the 'selected' occurrences ; 2. Define the Html element for this field in the layout inside the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; <x-subst type="checkbox" name="CHK_SELECTED.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity>
; Mark the selected occurrences for deletion setocc "<$entname>", 1 forentity "<$entname>" if (CHK_SELECTED.<$entname>) remocc "<$entname>", 0 endif endfor #endif
; Initialize message frame so we can use it for a store log clrmess
#ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Initialize a component variable holding the data validation error as reported by the entity and field error triggers ; Note that this needs to be done before store initiation. ; (See 'trigger error' snippets for DSPs) <DATAERRORS> = $newstruct <DATAERRORS>->$name = "Data validation errors" #endif
; Initiate the store store/e "<$entname>" selectcase $status case 0 ; Store successful -> report putmess "Store successful." commit selectcase $procerror case 0 ; Commit successful -> report putmess "Commit successful." elsecase ; Commit failed -> report putmess "Commit failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." rollback endselectcase case 1 ; No modifications -> report ; Instruct browser to show the error log putmess "No modifications." elsecase ; store failed -> report $procerror (more information also available in $procerrorcontext) putmess "Store failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))."
#ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Also report the validation errors that might have been reported in <DATAERRORS> putmess <DATAERRORS>->$dbgstring #endif
; Perfromm rollback rollback selectcase $procerror case 0 ; rollback ok putmess "Rollback successful." elsecase ; rollback also failed putmess "Rollback failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." endselectcase endselectcase
return 0
end
Button to save data to the database

trigger detail ; Stores modified occurrences into the database and deletes any occurrences marked for deletion from the database. ; Code is executed on the server.
; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Optionally, define a component variable of type struct and report any validation errors to it in the error triggers of the entity and field. ; Define a constant DATAERRORS with the name of this component variable. ; 3. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated in each occurrence: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-subst type="submit" name="BTN_STORE.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity> ; 4. This trigger reports in the message frame, which you need to display in your layout using the following HTML: ; <x-subst type="function" name="$putmess"> ; putmess area - display the contents of the message frame ; </x-subst>
#ifdefined option_1 ; Delete the selected occurrences (or perform some other action on the selected occurrences) ; TO DO: ; 1. Add an additional boolean field (e.g. checkbox) to the structure of the entity to be controlled. ; This field is used to hold the 'selected' occurrences. ; 2. Define the HTML element for this field in the layout inside the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated in each occurrence: ; <x-entity name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; <x-occurrence name="MYENTITY.MYMODEL"> ; ... ; <x-subst type="checkbox" name="CHK_SELECTED.MYENTITY.MYMODEL" /> ; ... ; </x-occurrence> ; </x-entity>
; Mark the selected occurrences for deletion setocc "<$entname>", 1 forentity "<$entname>" if (CHK_SELECTED.<$entname>) remocc "<$entname>", 0 endif endfor #endif
; Initialize message frame so it can be used for logging clrmess
#ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Initialize a component variable holding the data validation error as reported by the entity and field error triggers ; Note that this needs to be done before store initiation. ; (See 'trigger error' snippets for USPs) <DATAERRORS> = $newstruct <DATAERRORS>->$name = "Data validation errors" #endif
; Initiate the store store/e "<$entname>" selectcase $status case 0 ; Store successful -> report putmess "Store successful." commit selectcase $procerror case 0 ; Commit successful -> report putmess "Commit successful." elsecase ; Commit failed -> report putmess "Commit failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." rollback endselectcase case 1 ; No modifications -> report ; Instruct browser to show the error log putmess "No modifications." elsecase ; store failed -> report $procerror (more information also available in $procerrorcontext) putmess "Store failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))."
#ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Also report the validation errors that might have been reported in <DATAERRORS> putmess <DATAERRORS>->$dbgstring #endif
; Perfromm rollback rollback selectcase $procerror case 0 ; rollback ok putmess "Rollback successful." elsecase ; rollback also failed putmess "Rollback failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." endselectcase endselectcase
return 0
end
